instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [solved]820-2879 Does Not Stay On With Battery Power
threads.message: Hi louis, hey guys im back to old crap again, working on a 820-2879 the issue i'm having is that it sees the battery when on with the charger plugged in it even charges the battery, but as soon as i unplug the charger lights out as if i'm testing it without a battery. When  plugged in it calculates battery life and sees the battery that's whats confusing me board looks ok any ideas on what is going on here.

threads.title: [solved]820-2879 Does Not Stay On With Battery Power
[solved]820-2879 Does Not Stay On With Battery Power
threads.message: Run EFI ASD sensor test, report errors....

threads.title: [solved]820-2879 Does Not Stay On With Battery Power
threads.message:
If it sees the battery and charges the battery with the charger plugged in but doesn't work off of just the battery. hmm.

what is pp3v42_g3h when the battery is plugged in by itself without the charger?

threads.title: [solved]820-2879 Does Not Stay On With Battery Power
[solved]820-2879 Does Not Stay On With Battery Power
threads.message:
[QUOTE="larossmann, post: 1713"][url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u14u1q_GjRg[/url] is relevant to this[/QUOTE]

This video was right on the spot pin 3 of D6905 was not making contact, i had to scratch away some of the trace re soldered pin 3 to the trace and bingo problem solved !!! Thanks again professor louis best teacher ever!!!!
